article: In the mountains of Kenya , an old man stands at a gate. His skin is aged and his hair is white. He is wearing _ school uniform. This man _ outside the Kapkenduiywa Primary School near Eldoret, Kenya. He has come many times over the last few months. Today, he watches the children sing in the school yard.He waits at the _ for the head teacher. He asks her the _ question as he always does. He asks if he can _ the school. In the past, the head teacher told him no. She told him that this school is for children. _ , this time she says yes. Today, 84-year-old Kimani Maruge will _ his first day of school. When Maruge decided he wanted to go to school, nothing could _ him. He said: "At first, the head teacher said no. I _ it must be because I did not have the blue school uniform. So, I saved my money and bought clothes." Many people _ why Maruge wanted to start school at such an old age. The reason is _ --- he was not able to attend school when he was younger. Maruge wanted to learn to read and write for many _ . He wanted to be able to read _ from friends , family and the government. He also wanted to be able to _ official business papers. He wanted to be able to make more educated _ . When Maruge started school, he attended with three of his children's children. They were all in higher 51 _ than Maruge. However, with much hard work, Maruge learned quickly. "I want all children in the world to be educated. That is what I _ hope to see. _ it's hard for me to go to the school alone, the urge to learn keeps me _ ," Maruge said.  Although Maruge died in 2009 at 90, his story lives on . And his message is simple. As Maruge once said, "A person is never too old to learn."
